alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Southern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 5:34AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Patchy Dense Fog Across Parts of Lake and Inland Volusia Counties Early This Morning... At 530 AM, surface observations and satellite imagery showed locally dense fog had formed across Lake and northwest Volusia Counties. The fog appeared to be a little more dense and widespread across northern Lake County, from the Villages eastward across the Ocala Forest to Lake George and the along the Saint Johns River basin. Visibilities across this area may be reduced to less then one mile in some locations and could drop to a few hundred yards or less prior to sunrise. Motorist on areas roadways north of I-4, such as State Roads 44 and 19, and U.S. Highway 17 should prepare to encounter rapid changes in visibility from locally dense fog. When driving in fog, reduce your speed, use only your low beam headlights, and leave extra distance between your vehicle and the one in front of you. The fog is expected to burn off between 8 and 9 AM.

area.areaDesc: Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Southern Lake County
